#Text=Viareggio
#Text=Viareggio is a smaller city in Tuscany , in Versilia in the province of Lucca in Italy .
#Text=The city is 23.76 miles to Pisa , 17.67 miles to Massa , 29.87 miles to Livorno , and 59.5 miles to Florence .
#Text=Understand
#Text=The town is not very useful to most travellers as the beach is completely private , taken over by members only beach clubs .
#Text=The town is famous for its carnival Carnivale di Viareggio in a neighboring city Torre del Lago .
#Text=The town is gay friendly , and is surrounded by many attractive cities .
#Text=It is also a less expensive alternative to some surrounding beach towns .
#Text=The city is located on the beautiful Tyrrhenian Sea , and the country surrounding the city is an area of beautiful hills and quaint farm houses .
#Text=By train
#Text=Viareggio is on the line between Genova and Rome and can be reached by local trains from Pisa ( 15 minutes ) and from La Spezia ( 1 hour ) .
#Text=From Viareggio there is also a very slow line to Lucca ( 15 minutes ) , Montecatini ( 45 minutes ) , Pistoia ( 1 hour ) , Prato ( 75 minutes ) and Florence ( 90 minutes ) .
#Text=By plane
#Text=The closest airport is in Pisa .

#Text=From there it 's possible to reach Viareggio by train ( at the station Pisa Airport take the train to Pisa centrale and then the regional train to La Spezia with stops in Torre del Lago Puccini and Viareggio ) or by bus ( in the large square in front of the airport go to the bus stop of Vaibus and take the bus to Torre del Lago and Viareggio ; tickets on board ) .
#Text=From Florence airport take the bus Vaibus to Lucca , Torre del Lago , Viareggio .
#Text=The bus stop is in front of the airport , at the beginning of the motorway ( tickets on board ) .
#Text=By bus
#Text=There are bus lines of Vaibus to and from Forte dei marmi , Lucca , Pisa , Florence and Montecatini .
#Text=Events
#Text=: 9 February – 5 March 2019 .
#Text=A massive ( 800,000+ ) pre-Lent carnival featuring parades , fiestas , muscials , and theatrical events .
#Text=Learn
#Text=Centro Giacomo Puccini ( Italian language school ) , Via Vespucci 173 , ☏ +390584430253 .
#Text=09.00-14.00. For those wishing to learn Italian , Centro Giacomo Puccini offers 2-week sessions for beginners and advanced alike .
#Text=Eat
#Text=Tito del Molo is a very good , but pretty expensive restaurant .
#Text=They have good fish , as do all eateries in the area .
#Text=Small publics are favorite places to dine in Viareggio , because the people are friendly , and the food is great .
#Text=A great experience is making a meal of your own of freshly caught fish ( catch them yourself )
#Text=any local will be willing to help you with the fish , and all the fish markets have beautiful , fresh products , as well as meats , cheeses and produce .
#Text=Sleep
#Text=When you stay in Viareggio , you can stay in a lot very comfortable hotels .
#Text=Hotel Eur Lido di Camaiore , ☏ +390584618251 , fax : +390584618253 .
#Text=– Viale le Colombo , 175 , Lido di Camaiore .
#Text=• .
#Text=Three star hotel a few hundreds metres away from the sea and the coast line of Versilia , which presents 75 bedrooms with private bath , shower and a large swimming pool .
#Text=The rates change according to the season , as well as the minimum stay .
#Text=Principe di Piemonte , Piazza Puccini
#Text=1 .
#Text=The Principe di Piemonte Hotel is located on the promenade within close proximity to shops , bars and restaurants .
#Text=Only 800 meters from the centre of Viareggio .
#Text=Astor Hotel Viareggio , Viale Carducci 54 .

#Text=Hotel Astor is ideally located in the best position fronts to the sea and the most famous Viareggio ’s promenade for shopping , nearby the natural pinewoods for free wellness and sport activities .
#Text=Hotel Residence Luana , Via Ugo Foscolo 36 , ☏ +39058444238 .
#Text=Hotel Residence Luana is located in the city center of Viareggio , only 200m far from the sea and the beaches , nearby the promenade .
#Text=B&B Arsella , Via Vespucci , 39 - +39 338 33 68 498 - www . arsellaviareggio . it
#Text=Bed & Breakfast Arsella is between the sea promenade and the West Pinewood Park .
#Text=Its fantastic position it’a a short walk to the seafront with equipped beach and the most famous esplanade with boutiques , coffee houses and restaurant .
#Text=As much near is the Pinewood Park , a true green oasis with several entertainments for young and older people ( minigolf , tennis club , ballroom , carousels ) .
#Text=Go next
#Text=Great day trips can be taken to neighboring Lucca !
#Text=Some great trips include going to :
#Text=Guinigi Tower , a tower from the 15th century , at the home of Lucca 's leading family .
#Text=The tower is unique because if its spectacular oaks that grow through the tall structure .
#Text=Duomo di San Martino is the home of Volto Santo ( Holy Face ) A wooden figure of Christ that is believed to have the actual face of Christ .

#Text=A trip to the ' walls that surrounded the city in the 16th and 19th centuries is always beautiful , but they are paved on top , and a bike trip around the top makes the experience unforgettable .
#Text=Collodi is a beautiful town that is also the birthplace of Pincchio .
#Text=Pinocchio Park is a must for families with small children , though adults can take tours of the famous villas .
